entry.title: Allegro Brillante (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that George Balanchine said Allegro Brillante (dancers pictured) "contains everything I knew about classical ballet – in thirteen minutes"?

entry.title: birders in New York City (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that birders in New York City have recorded over 400 species?

entry.title: Kazim al-Samawi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Iraqi poet Kazim al-Samawi spent more than half his life in political exile and was called "The Sheikh of the Exiles"?

entry.title: Piedmont Hotel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Piedmont Hotel hosted a former, a current, and a future U.S. president in one week?

entry.title: Royston Brooks (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Royston Brooks was the last European to serve as the Commanding Officer of the Royal Hong Kong Auxiliary Air Force from 1988 to 1990?

entry.title: National Firefighter Registry (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the U.S. National Firefighter Registry will match state cancer data with voluntarily collected work history data from firefighters?

entry.title: George Gray (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Scottish physician George Gray received the thanks of the Chinese government for his work during the Manchurian plague of 1910–11?

entry.title: Rockstar Leeds (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Rockstar Leeds was once based at a decommissioned church?
